API

Directive: MdcCardPrimaryDirective

Selector: [mdcCardPrimary]

Directive for the primary area (containing titles and subtitles) of a card. The primary area is typically composed of a title (MdcCardTitleDirective), and subtitle (MdcCardSubtitleDirective). This directive should be put inside the card itself (MdcCardDirective), or inside an horizontal block in the card (MdcCardHorizontalDirective).

Directive: MdcCardTitleDirective

Selector: [mdcCardTitle]

Directive for the title of a card. Should be put inside the primary area (MdcCardPrimaryDirective) of a card.

Property Description
@Input()

large

any

When this input is defined and does not have value false, the title will be made larger.

Directive: MdcCardSubtitleDirective

Selector: [mdcCardSubtitle]

Directive for the subtitle of a card. Should be put inside the primary area (MdcCardPrimaryDirective) of a card.

Directive: MdcCardTextDirective

Selector: [mdcCardText]

Directive for the textual content of the card. If used, this directive should be put inside the card itself ( (MdcCardDirective)), or inside an horizontal block in the card (MdcCardHorizontalDirective)

Directive: MdcCardMediaDirective

Selector: [mdcCardMedia]

Directive for rich media embedded in cards. If used, this directive should be put inside the card itself (MdcCardDirective). For media items inside an horizonal block, use MdcCardMediaItemDirective instead.

Directive: MdcCardActionsDirective

Selector: [mdcCardActions]

Directive for showing the different actions a user can take. Composed of one or more card actions, which must be buttons that have the MdcButtonDirective. (Icon buttons as actions are currently not supported by the upstream Material Components Web library. Once they are supported, we'll add support for them as card actions too).

Property Description
@Input()

compact

any

When this input is defined and does not have value false, all contained buttions will automagically get compact styling, which is equal to setting the compact input on the buttons individually.
@Input()

vertical

any

When this input is defined and does not have value false, the actions are layed out vertically inside of horizontally.

Directive: MdcCardHorizontalDirective

Selector: [mdcCardHorizontal]

Directive for stacking multiple card blocks horizontally instead of vertically inside the card. This directive should be put inside the card itself (MdcCardDirective) and wraps the blocks that should be stacked horizontally, such as MdcCardPrimaryDirective, MdcCardMediaItemDirective, and MdcCardActionsDirective.

Directive: MdcCardMediaItemDirective

Selector: [mdcCardMediaItem]

Directive for media items. They are intended for use in horizontal blocks, taking up a fixed height, rather than stretching to the width of the card. Use the sizeFactor input to select from some predefined media item sizes.

Property Description
@Input()

sizeFactor

any

Directive to select the media item size. Possible values are:
1 (the default): sets the height to 80px.
1.5: sets the height to 120px.
2: sets the height to 160px.
3: sets the height to 240px.
Any other value will reset sizeFactor to 1, to have a 80px height.

Directive: MdcCardDirective

Selector: [mdcCard]

Directive for a material designed card. The card can be composed with the following directives: MdcCardPrimaryDirective, MdcCardTextDirective, MdcCardMediaDirective, MdcCardActionsDirective, MdcCardHorizontalDirective.
